best_practices.description: Specialized Technical Laws for high-end Website development. Focus: Institutional-grade accessibility and premium aesthetics (Animations, UI/UX).

law.name: Semantic Hierarchy
law.rule: Every page MUST have exactly one [h1]. Navigation must be wrapped in [nav]. Main content must be wrapped in [main].

law.name: Fragment Sharding
law.rule: Complex layouts must be sharded into reusable 'Fragments' (e.g., Hero, Features, CTA) stored in production/fragments/.

law.name: Keyboard Supremacy
law.rule: All interactive elements must be reachable via [Tab] and visually highlighted when focused.

law.name: ARIA Grounding
law.rule: Use [aria-label] for icon-only buttons. Use [aria-expanded] for mobile menus and accordions.

law.name: Contrast Law
law.rule: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast for all text. No color-only communication.

law.name: Dynamic Scrolling
law.rule: Implement custom 'side scroller' scrollbars using the Aesthetic Layer tokens. Scroll behavior must be smooth.

law.name: Micro-Interactions
law.rule: All buttons and links must have 'hover' and 'active' transitions. Use the spring-animation tokens from AESTHETIC_LAYER.xml.

law.name: Highlight Identity
law.rule: Custom [::selection] highlights must match the brand's primary color.

law.name: Staggered Entry
law.rule: Lists and groups of cards must use staggered entrance animations (100ms offset per item).

law.name: Hydration Matching
law.rule: Server-side rendered content must match client-side hydration exactly to avoid layout shifts.

law.name: LCP Priority
law.rule: Preload the LCP Hero image. Secondary images must be lazy-loaded.
